result.reason: SqlConnectionsLoader.GetDecryptionKey crashes when metaData.Protected is empty on first SQL connection setup because PasswordAuthenticator rejects null/empty cipherText
result.approach: In GetDecryptionKey, check if metaData.Protected is null or empty before constructing PasswordAuthenticator; if empty, treat as unprotected (use default password directly without authentication) or call HandleFirstRun to initialize the Protected field first

attempts.raw_output:
The issue is clear. When first connecting to MSSQL (or when the database has no encrypted `Protected` field), `metaData.Protected` is empty, causing `PasswordAuthenticator` to throw because `cipherText.ThrowIfNullOrEmpty()` rejects it.

```json
{"decision":"implement","reason":"SqlConnectionsLoader.GetDecryptionKey crashes when metaData.Protected is empty on first SQL connection setup because PasswordAuthenticator rejects null/empty cipherText","priority":"P2-bug","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/Config/Connections/SqlConnectionsLoader.cs"],"approach":"In GetDecryptionKey, check if metaData.Protected is null or empty before constructing PasswordAuthenticator; if empty, treat as unprotected (use default password directly without authentication) or call HandleFirstRun to initialize the Protected field first"}
```
